Swords Dance (Dark).description: Swords Dance Weavile makes for a great cleaner against types like Flying, Ground, and Dragon, as it deals with nuisances like Celesteela, Landorus, and Mega Altaria. Icium Z-boosted Icicle Crash lets Weavile break through and OHKO defensive walls like Celesteela, Gastrodon, and Ferrothorn after minimal chip damage at +2 and immediately remove Mega Diancie and bulkier variants of Mega Altaria. Although it is less consistent than Icicle Crash, Triple Axel provides Weavile with much higher wallbreaking power and the ability to immediately remove Ogerpon-C at the cost of making it vulnerable to contact damage from Skarmory and Ferrothorn and checked more easily by Archaludon. However, this lets Weavile use Heavy-Duty Boots instead of Icium Z due to Triple Axel's higher damage ceiling than Icicle Crash. Knock Off removes key items from switch-ins like Rotom-W, Archaludon, and Celesteela, making them easier for Weavile to overwhelm later. Ice Shard picks off faster threats like Mega Aerodactyl and Choice Scarf users like Meowscarada, Roaring Moon, and Enamorus. Ting-Lu provides entry hazard support, which helps Weavile gain the appropriate thresholds for OHKOing defensive walls like Celesteela, and it also deals with special attackers like Volcarona, Tapu Lele, and Tapu Koko. Nasty Plot Hydreigon and Galarian Moltres form a potent wallbreaking core with Weavile, with the former dealing with Slowbro, Archaludon, and Toxapex and the latter handling faster threats like Latios and Enamorus. Weavile also fits on hyper offense teams, with teammates like Grimmsnarl providing dual screens support to give it more room to set up and Dragon Dance Mega Tyranitar battering down opposing teams for it to clean up later. If slotted in on balance teams, Weavile greatly appreciates Mega Sableye and Mandibuzz keeping entry hazards off the field and taking on Fighting-types like Sneasler. Mandibuzz also checks physical setup sweepers like Mega Scizor with Foul Play and pivots Weavile in with U-turn.

Choice Scarf (Ice).description: Choice Scarf Weavile is an excellent revenge killer on Ice teams because of its powerful STAB combination, access to Pursuit, and an incredible Speed stat that allows it to outspeed threats like Mega Aerodactyl, Mega Lopunny, and Choice Scarf users like Iron Boulder, Blacephalon, and Tapu Lele. Pursuit allows Weavile to trap and eliminate foes like Blacephalon and Iron Boulder that threaten Ice teams, while Punishment threatens Z-Celebrate Victini and Z-Happy Hour users like Jirachi and Hisuian Zoroark. Knock Off hinders defensive switch-ins like Corviknight, Ferrothorn, and Toxapex by removing their Leftovers or Heavy-Duty Boots. Low Kick targets foes like Heatran, Iron Treads, and Mega Tyranitar. Kyurem, Alolan Ninetales, and Arctozolt are excellent partners for their ability to break through bulky Water-types like Toxapex, Rotom-W, and Swampert, which Weavile struggles against. Arctozolt, Galarian Darmanitan, Cetitan, and Kyurem can also wear down or eliminate Steel-types like Skarmory, Corviknight, Ferrothorn, and Archaludon, allowing Weavile to clean up late-game. Cloyster and Piloswine set entry hazards, which, in conjunction with Weavile's Knock Off removing Heavy-Duty Boots, can wear down bulky foes. Additionally, Cloyster also provides entry hazard removal with Rapid Spin, increasing Weavile's survivability, while Piloswine can check Fire-types like Volcarona and Heatran.

Stallbreaker (Flying).description: Gliscor is a great addition to Flying teams, as its part-Ground typing allows it to be a useful asset in the Electric and Rock matchups, threatening the likes of Magnezone, Zeraora, and Hisuian Arcanine. Knock Off removes important items such as Heavy-Duty Boots from Volcarona, Tornadus-T, and Dragonite and Leftovers from Corviknight. Taunt shuts down entry hazard attempts as well as attempts to remove its teammates' hazards with Defog. Roost grants Gliscor a form of longevity on top of Poison Heal. 244 HP and 20 Defense EVs allow it to survive a V-create from Choice Band Victini, while 8 Speed EVs outspeed Modest Raging Bolt. Corviknight and Mantine remove hazards with Defog so Gliscor can switch in more safely. Additionally, Corviknight provides slow pivoting and threatens Fairy-types like Tapu Lele and Mega Diancie, while Mantine handles Water-types like Barraskewda and Mega Swampert. Thundurus-T takes pressure off Gliscor by providing an additional Electric immunity; it also threatens Water- and Flying-types such as Urshifu-R, Swampert, Mantine, and Corviknight with its coverage. It appreciates Gliscor removing Clodsire and blocking entry hazard setup with Taunt. Late-game sweepers such as Mega Charizard Y and Galarian Moltres appreciate Gliscor's stallbreaking against Toxapex, Clodsire, and Heatran so they can start their own sweep. In return, Mega Charizard Y handles Ferrothorn, Gastrodon, and Alolan Ninetales, while Galarian Moltres handles Ghost- and Psychic-types such as Gholdengo, Ceruledge, and Slowbro.

Choice Band (Ground).description: Mamoswine is an incredible Choice Band user for Ground-type teams thanks to its raw power and excellent STAB coverage, making it a force to be reckoned with. Ice Shard helps it pick off faster Pokemon that can threaten it, such as Thundurus-T, Enamorus, and Latias. Knock Off heavily weakens Pokemon reliant on their items, such as Corviknight, Porygon2, and Celesteela, making them much easier for Mamoswine to take advantage of later on. Alternatively, Superpower is Mamoswine’s best option for beating bulky Pokemon such as Blissey, Ferrothorn, and Rotom-W. Landorus is an outstanding teammate for Mamoswine to have, as it can threaten physical walls Mamoswine would rather not face, such as Mega Venusaur, Tapu Fini, and Slowbro, and help it beat Ground-immune Pokemon such as Skarmory and Rotom-W with Gravity. Scale Shot Mega Garchomp and Sand Rush Excadrill appreciate Mamoswine wearing down bulky Pokemon such as Celesteela and Gliscor for them to clean up late-game. Ting-Lu and Hippowdon help Mamoswine do its job more effectively by setting up entry hazards, allowing it to net more KOs. They also can rack up chip damage with Whirlwind, and Hippowdon sets sand for further residual damage. Clodsire and Gastrodon can safely switch into Water-type moves that threaten Mamoswine, and they can set hazards to help its wallbreaking. Clodsire, in particular, is able to switch into Grass-type attacks from the likes of Choice Scarf Meowscarada, Ogerpon-W, and Brambleghast, and it can inflict status and set Toxic Spikes up, limiting the longevity of stall Pokemon such as Slowbro, Ting-Lu, and Blissey. Gastrodon is an excellent Water Absorb user that can ease up Water matchups for Mamoswine, as it can safely wall Water-type Pokemon such as Choice Specs Walking Wake, Dondozo, and Mega Swampert with the proper moveset to take advantage of later on.

Swords Dance (Fighting).description: For Fighting teams, Mega Gallade is one of the best choices, courtesy of its incredible offensive power, typing, and Speed, being the best counter to Fighting's biggest roadblock, Toxapex. Swords Dance increases Mega Gallade's power to the maximum, letting it freely overpower the likes of Mandibuzz and Celesteela. Zen Headbutt beautifully complements a Fighting-type STAB move, as it lets Mega Gallade easily break through any opposing Poison-types that may be annoying walls such as Mega Venusaur, Toxapex, and Clodsire. Knock Off is another tool in Mega Gallade's arsenal, which lets it take care of Psychic- and Ghost-types—such as Gholdengo, Slowbro, and Aegislash—and wears down Celesteela into range of Close Combat finishing it off. Triple Axel is another option to easily take care of Flying-types such as Landorus-T, Dragonite, and Enamorus. Shadow Sneak can also be considered to pick off faster weakened threats such as Gengar, Choice Scarf Blacephalon, and Mega Alakazam. With all its benefits, Mega Gallade has a few checks in Skeledirge and defensive Gholdengo; hence, offensive Great Tusk and Urshifu-R are great partners in helping take these down. Defensive Great Tusk also helps in setting and removing entry hazards, which is appreciated by Mega Gallade. Mega Gallade is also easily revenge killed by faster offensive threats such as Tornadus-T and Choice Scarf Blacephalon, so Assault Vest Iron Hands is a good check to stop these in their tracks and deal good damage back while also being able to pivot in Mega Gallade with Volt Switch. Breloom and Lilligant-H also helps significantly in the Water matchup against the likes of Mega Swampert and Barraskewda; they can also put opposing foes to sleep to make Gallade's setup easier. Choice Scarf Sneasler helps in the Fairy matchup against the likes of Choice Scarf Tapu Lele and Tapu Koko while also being able to set and absorb Toxic Spikes and can U-Turn to pivot in Mega Gallade safely. Iron Valiant is also an amazing partner in the form of a specially offensive threat, complementing Mega Gallade, as it can easily take care of Mega Sableye. Choice Scarf Iron Valiant also outspeeds Mega Swampert under rain and Regieleki under Electric Terrain, making it a great revenge killer if Mega Gallade gets knocked out.

Swords Dance (Psychic).description: Mega Gallade is a potent wallbreaker on Psychic teams thanks to its greatly appreciated Dark neutrality and good coverage in Knock Off and Triple Axel. Swords Dance allows Mega Gallade to grab a boost on a forced switch and potentially win the game with its high base Speed and astronomical Attack after one boost. Knock Off is crucial to hit opposing Psychic- and Ghost-types such as Slowbro and Gholdengo that would otherwise wall this set, and its item removal is always handy in breaking defensive teams reliant on Heavy-Duty Boots down with Stealth Rock damage and removing key items from Celesteela and Toxapex. Finally, Zen Headbutt does massive work against Poison teams after a single Swords Dance and deals high amounts of damage to Fighting-resistant Pokemon such as Buzzwole and Toxapex. Triple Axel is another alternative, allowing Mega Gallade to hit Flying- and Dragon-types such as Landorus-T and Garchomp. Shadow Sneak can allow Mega Gallade to outspeed and take out Ghost-types such as Choice Scarf Gholdengo and Choice Scarf Blacephalon that could otherwise beat it. Tapu Lele forms a wallbreaking core with Mega Gallade, as they both threaten common checks to each other. Tapu Lele beats Mega Sableye with Moonblast, while Mega Gallade crushes Steel-types such as Heatran and Celesteela that trouble Tapu Lele with Close Combat. Jirachi can take Fairy-type attacks such as Tapu Lele's Moonblast aimed for Mega Gallade, as well as paralyze threats and beat them down with Thunder Wave and Serene Grace-boosted Iron Head, letting Mega Gallade break through them with a timely paralysis. Finally, Jirachi provides Stealth Rock support and a safe pivot in with U-turn. Victini provides speed control with Choice Scarf and defeats Steel-types such as Choice Scarf Gholdengo that Mega Gallade is forced out by while appreciating Mega Gallade's ability to pound Heatran to dust. Deoxys-S provides entry hazard and dual screens support, which Mega Gallade can take advantage of with Knock Off and Swords Dance to break through bulkier teams. Slowbro provides crucial momentum with Teleport while also being able to annoy teams with Scald burns and Future Sight and switch in repeatedly through Regenerator. Celebi can break through troubling physical walls such as Hippowdon and Dondozo that Mega Gallade struggles to make progress against. Finally, Choice Scarf Latias can both remove entry hazards with Defog and use Healing Wish to give Mega Gallade a second chance to break through the opposing team.

Bulky Pivot (Electric).description: With its access to Levitate, Rotom-W is nearly mandatory on all Electric teams. Its Ground immunity and Water-type resistance make Pokemon like Mega Swampert unable to bother it; it also has access to Hydro Pump to hit annoying Ground-types such as Great Tusk and Hippowdon. Rotom-W is also a really good blanket check to Ice- and Fire-types like Mamoswine, Victini, and Galarian Darmanitan. Volt Switch provides great momentum, which is needed in hyper offense teams. In addition to providing momentum, Rotom-W has access to Will-O-Wisp and Toxic, crippling foes such as Mega Garchomp and Mimikyu with Will-O-Wisp, while Toxic punishes switch-ins such as Gastrodon and Kyurem. Defog lets Rotom-W compress roles, freeing up Zapdos to run Choice Specs, while Rotom-W prevents hazards from hurting teammates. Pain Split is another option, as it massively improves Rotom-W's longevity; however, this requires Zapdos to run Defog. The 44 invested Speed EVs ensure Rotom-W outspeeds Jolly Azumarill so that it can punish Azumarill for setting up Belly Drum with Will-O-Wisp or Volt Switch. Zapdos covers Rotom-W's weakness to Grass-types with access to Hurricane and Heat Wave, being able to OHKO the likes of Mega Venusaur and Ferrothorn, respectively, while also being immune to Mold Breaker Excadrill's Earthquake. Regieleki can be used as a Rapid Spinner, removing pressure from Rotom-W to function as the only hazard removal while also luring in Ground-types that Rotom-W can punish such as Iron Treads or Great Tusk. With access to Taunt and having an amazing Speed tier, Zeraora can prevent hazards from coming up and allow Rotom-W to switch in freely and get off a strong Hydro Pump or gain a lot of momentum and Volt Switch into one of its offensive teammates. Zeraora also pressures Hydreigon and Gholdengo, which can use Rotom-W as setup fodder. Iron Hands provides the coverage and bulk against Pokemon like Dragon Dance Dragonite, Volcarona, and SubRoost Kyurem that Rotom-W can't deal with while also putting a lot of pressure on Normal teams, as Rotom-W can Volt Switch against Blissey into Iron Hands and force Blissey to tank a hit or switch out. Alolan Raichu gives Rotom-W's slow Volt Switch a lot of value as it is strong but frail, being able to deal with Ice-types like Baxcalibut with Focus Blast and Poison-types like Mega Venusaur and Clodsire with Psyshock. Magnezone provides a valuable Poison immunity while also checking other threats like Tapu Lele, Meowscarada, and Alolan Ninetales.

Specially Defensive (Steel).description: Heatran is a mainstay on Steel teams due to its ability, Flash Fire, letting it switch into threats like Blacephalon, Victini, and Iron Moth. Lava Plume makes Heatran annoying to switch into thanks to its burn chance, while Magma Storm softens walls like Toxapex and Rotom-W by trapping them. Earth Power threatens Poison- and Fire-types and makes Heatran an important asset against opposing Steel teams by hitting opposing Heatran. Roar lets Heatran phaze the likes of Nasty Plot Hydreigon and Z-Celebrate Victini and synergizes well with Stealth Rock to deal extra damage. Alternatively, Toxic cripples walls like Mantine and Rotom-W, as well as Pokemon that fancy switching into Heatran such as Volcarona and Mega Charizard Y. Substitute pairs well with Toxic and allows Heatran to be massively annoying against types like Steel, Electric, and Psychic by capitalizing on the many switches it forces in these matchups. Thanks to their typing and bulk, Corviknight and Celesteela are excellent teammates to check Ground- and Fighting-types like Mamoswine and Great Tusk for Heatran. Setup sweepers like Mega Scizor and Z-Happy Hour Jirachi appreciate Heatran wearing down teams with burn and Toxic. Iron Treads removes entry hazards with Rapid Spin and deals with Mega Charizard Y, Zeraora, and Cinderace with its Choice Scarf set. Ferrothorn checks Water-types like Mega Swampert and Urshifu-R and aids Heatran with Spikes and Leech Seed.

Offensive Utility (Fire).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Band (Psychic).description: Victini is a great wallbreaker on Psychic teams due to its well-rounded coverage and signature move in V-create, easing the matchup against Steel, Grass, and Ice teams. Bolt Strike threatens bulky Water-types such as Toxapex, Slowbro, and Tapu Fini that resist V-create. U-turn preserves Psychic's momentum and allows Victini to switch out of Pokemon that wall it like Dragonite and Mega Altaria. Trick cripples common switch-ins such as Storm Drain Gastrodon, Toxapex, and Skeledirge, while Brick Break lets Victini further threaten Steel and Dark teams by hitting Heatran and Mega Tyranitar hard. Choice Scarf Tapu Lele is an excellent teammate due to its ability to check Dark- and Dragon-types like Weavile, Kommo-o, and Hydreigon. It also sets up Psychic Terrain, protecting Victini from priority moves from the likes of Mimikyu and Azumarill. Jirachi and Celebi aid in Victini's wallbreaking by setting up Stealth Rock and replenishing its HP with Healing Wish. Furthermore, they form a pivot core with Victini that deals sizable chip damage while keeping momentum. Latias also provides Healing Wish support and removes entry hazards with Defog to preserve Victini's longevity. Mega Gallade and Victini can each weaken certain physical walls for the other to dispose of such as Ting-Lu and Skeledirge. Deoxys-S breaks through roadblocks like Toxapex, Garchomp, and Swampert and aids in cleaning weakened Flying and Water teams. Slowbro switches into most Water- and Ground-types that threaten Victini, like Urshifu-R and Excadrill, and it brings Victini into the field with Teleport.

Z-Celebrate (Fire).description: Victini is an excellent user of Z-Celebrate, which not only boosts its natural bulk, but also its amazing offensive potential. Stored Power in tandem with Z-Celebrate can easily shred through bulky Pokemon such as Toxapex and Gliscor. Focus Blast is a great form of coverage for Victini, as it can break down Dark-, Rock-, and Steel-types such as Tyranitar, Hisuian Arcanine, and Heatran; its low accuracy is also boosted by Victory Star. Alternatively, after a boost, Thunderbolt can threaten Water- and Flying-type Pokemon such as non-Choice Scarf Greninja, Pelipper, and Mega Charizard Y. Torkoal is an excellent teammate to pair with Victini, as not only does it provide sun to boost Victini's Searing Shot, notably giving it a favorable roll to take out Tapu Lele after a boost, but it also provides entry hazard removal in Rapid Spin. Torkoal can also set Stealth Rock of its own, which breaks Sturdy of foes like Skarmory and Ogerpon-C, allowing Victini to sweep. Cinderace can break through bulky Pokemon such as Blissey with itsLibero-boosted STAB High Jump Kick while also using Court Change to remove hazards for Victini. Rotom-H provides an immunity to Ground-types with Levitate and assists by setting up dual screens, letting Victini take advantage of them to set up; it also has a niche in being another hazard removal teammate with Defog. Volcarona's Bug typing and access to Quiver Dance and Bug Buzz can check threatening Dark-types such as Meowscarada, Roaring Moon, and Hydreigon. Mega Charizard X is a powerful wallbreak that, paired alongside Victini, can take out Dragon-type threats such as Dragonite after its Multiscale is worn down and Kyurem. Ceruledge is another offensive setup sweeper that can take out Ghost-type Pokemon like Blacephalon and a weakened Iron Boulder with Shadow Sneak.

Swords Dance (Ground).description: Having multiple ways to boost its Speed and holding a nearly unresisted STAB combination, Excadrill is a potent setup sweeper for Ground-type sand teams, as it can take advantage of forced switches by posing as its Choice Band set. Corkscrew Crash lets Excadrill overwhelm multiple checks, OHKOing Tornadus-T when unboosted; Sinistcha, Mega Latias, and Mega Sableye at +2; and Mega Venusaur at +2 after Stealth Rock damage. Rapid Spin lets Excadrill compress utility by removing entry hazards for its team while also raising its Speed; Rapid Spin is also a good move to finish foes off to make Excadrill more difficult to revenge kill. Excadrill appreciates Hippowdon, which is a sand setter required to easily enable Sand Rush. Excadrill can struggle against Water-types that are immune to Ground such as Rotom-W and Pelipper, so it appreciates Gastrodon and Clodsire as allies to pivot to; in turn they can support Excadrill by setting entry hazards or crippling the aforementioned foes with status. Flying-types such as Mega Charizard Y, Zapdos, and Skarmory can also be problematic for Excadrill to deal with, so checks such as Mega Garchomp and Mamoswine are appreciated.

Utility (Grass).description: Whimsicott is a unique and effective pivot option for Grass teams by virtue of its Prankster ability and many viable support moves. U-turn provides Whimsicott with a means to pivot into another teammate in order to maintain momentum. Alternatively, Knock Off can be used over U-turn to take advantage of Encore forcing switches by providing important item removal. The given EV spread makes Whimsicott as fast as possible while maximizing the damage of its Moonblast, letting it 2HKO Mega Sableye and Mandibuzz, and OHKO pokemon like Iron Valiant. Heavy-Duty Boots allows Whimsicott to switch in several times per match without being worn down by entry hazards. Ferrothorn is an excellent partner, since its Steel typing lets it wall Poison- and Steel-type attacks that threaten Whimsicott, and its entry hazards also pair well with Whimsicott's ability to force switches. Celebi is an excellent partner for Whimsicott thanks to its ability to threaten Poison and Steel teams that can make Whimsicott's opportunities to switch in very limited. Ogerpon-C benefits greatly from Whimsicott clearing away hazards so that it can make use of Sturdy to tank a hit it otherwise can't, and it appreciates Encore to help create setup opportunities. A Sunny Day set with Heat Rock can turn Whimsicott into a makeshift sun setter for teams that utilize Chlorophyll sweepers like Venusaur, Hisuian Lilligant, and Scovillain.

Choice Scarf.description: Galarian Darmanitan easily applies offensive pressure thanks to the sheer damage output of its moves and Speed with the combo of Gorilla Tactics + Choice Scarf, allowing it to act as a potent revenge killer and wallbreaker for Ice teams. Flare Blitz provides coverage against Steel-types including Corviknight and Ferrothorn. Earthquake further complements Galarian Darmanitarian's moveset to provide nearly unresisted coverage alongside its STAB Icicle Crash, OHKOing Fire-types that resist its other moves such as Ceruledge and Heatran. U-turn allows Galarian Darmanitan to gain momentum on predicted switches and wears down checks over time. As Galarian Darmanitan can struggle with Water-types such as Toxapex, Slowbro, and Araquanid, Kyurem and Alolan Ninetales make for formidable partners, as they hit these foes super effectively with Freeze-Dry and can take advantage of their passivity to apply further pressure on the opposing team. Getting Choice locked into the wrong move often forces Galarian Darmanitan to switch out; therefore, Piloswine and Articuno act as defensive partners to resort to in such scenarios. Articuno and Cloyster can provide entry hazard control to mitigate Galarian Darmanitan's weakness to Stealth Rock, raising its longevity, with the former also providing pivoting to ease Galarian Darmanitan's entry into the field. Other offensive partners such as Weavile and Cetitan can complement Galarian Darmanitan in applying offensive pressure to overwhelm opposing walls and potentially sweep.

Z-Happy Hour (Ghost).description: With a Ghost immunity, Hisuian Zoroark covers a crucial weakness for its team and makes use of it alongside Illusion to bluff as any of its allies efficiently and gain opportunities to set up and sweep. Focus Blast is unresisted alongside Shadow Ball and hits Dark-types that could be difficult to answer otherwise such as Hydreigon and Mega Tyranitar. Hyper Voice provides a complementary STAB option that shines in neutral matchups, 2HKOing Mega Venusaur and Toxapex after a boost, but Flamethrower complements Focus Blast to hit Steel-types such as Corviknight and Scizor. Hisuian Zoroark's sole weakness to Dark can lure in checks that can threaten a good portion of its team such as Alolan Muk and Mandibuzz. Mega Sableye is a good partner to check them in turn, and it can also prevent entry hazards from being set on its side with Magic Bounce to increase Hisuian Zoroark's longevity and allow it to bluff with Illusion further. Mimikyu discourages Dark-type attacks thanks to its Fairy typing, giving a safe option for Hisuian Zoroark to bluff as with Illusion, and an intact Disguise also lures the opposing team to expect setup and either bring in a physical wall or use utility moves such as Taunt and Will-O-Wisp that don't hinder Hisuian Zoroark as much they would Mimikyu, easing setup. Hisuian Zoroark's Illusion in general can be used to bluff as other Pokemon to lure counterplay to them that it exploits; for example, as Gholdengo, it can discourage status moves by pretending to have Good as Gold, and as Sinistcha, it can revenge kill unsuspecting foes that would normally outspeed Sinistcha.

Z-Happy Hour (Normal).description: Hisuian Zoroark provides defensive utility relevant to its team by being immune to Fighting, allowing it to easily pose as any of its allies with Illusion to find setup opportunities and sweep. Focus Blast and Shadow Ball provide unresisted coverage, allowing Hisuian Zoroark to defeat checks such as Mega Tyranitar, Heatran, and Hydreigon. Flamethrower hits foes it wouldn't OHKO otherwise, even after a boost, such as Ferrothorn, Corviknight after minimal chip, and opposing Hisuian Zoroark. Flamethrower alongside Focus Blast considerably eases the Steel matchup for its team, but Hyper Voice is an alternative that deals the most damage in neutral matchups, OHKOing Tapu Koko and Tornadus-T at +1 after Stealth Rock. Hyper Voice can also be used to trigger Breakneck Blitz over Z-Happy Hour to allow Hisuian Zoroark to lure in and overwhelm foes such as Keldeo, Hisuian Lilligant, and Landorus in a pinch. As Hisuian Zoroark lures in Dark-types to check it, Mega Lopunny is a solid partner to keep momentum against such foes, especially as Hisuian Zoroark can bluff as Mega Lopunny more effectively than other teammates, as both hold an item that cannot be removed by Trick or Switcheroo. Mega Lopunny also pressures special walls that Hisuian Zoroark can otherwise struggle with, such as Mega Sableye, Blissey, and Alolan Muk. Entry hazard control by Staraptor is also valuable to ensure Hisuan Zoroark's bluffing capabilities and raise its longevity; Staraptor can also provide a slow pivot to let Hisuian Zoroark come in safely. Chansey and Blissey can set Stealth Rock to let Hisuian Zoroark more easily threaten a sweep and can support it by providing safe pivoting for it with Teleport. In particular, it is easier for Hisuian Zoroark to disguise as Chansey due to a shared vulnerability to entry hazards.

Sticky Web (Bug).description: Galvantula serves as an excellent Sticky Web lead, supporting its offensive team members with speed control. Thunder in conjunction with Compound Eyes gives Galvantula an offensive presence, takes on opposing hazard-setting leads, threatens paralysis, and dents Water- and Flying-types. Energy Ball threatens bulky Ground-types like Great Tusk, Hippowdon, Swampert, and Gastrodon. Hidden Power Ice deals with Flying- and Dragon-types like Gliscor, the Landorus formes, Garchomp, and Dragonite. Thunder Wave can be used over Hidden Power Ice to paralyze setup sweepers and fast threats that can't be effectively slowed down with Sticky Web, most notably Dragonite, Galarian Zapdos, Mega Aerodactyl, opposing Mega Pinsir, and Volcarona, without having to rely on Thunder to do so. This comes at the cost of losing coverage against Pokemon that resist both Thunder and Energy Ball, however. Sticky Web lowers the amount of Quiver Dance boosts needed for Volcarona to outspeed Regieleki, Unburden Sneasler, and Sand Rush Excadrill, making its setup more efficient. Sticky Web also allows choice Scarf users like Kleavor and Buzzwole to outspeed those Pokemon, limiting the amount of revenge killing options against them and improving their effectiveness against Fire- and Rock-types by taking care of Choice Scarf Blacephalon, Hisuian Arcanine, and Iron Boulder. Sticky Web gives Mega Pinsir more opportunities to use Return instead of Quick Attack to increase its damage output or Earthquake to KO Pokemon that would usually threaten it like Choice Scarf Nihilego and Hisuian Arcanine. Scizor can OHKO or force Diancie out before it can Mega Evolve to allow Galvantula to set up Sticky Web against Fairy- and Rock-teams.

Agility (Bug).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Entry Hazard Wall (Grass).description:
Ferrothorn is a highly reliable wall in Grass teams, boasting good defensive stats, recovery, and an immunity to Poison. It's an incredible asset for Grass teams, as it can manage notable threats such as Kyurem, Tapu Lele, and Melmetal. Gyro Ball capitalizes on its low Speed and threatens Fairy-types and fast foes like Alolan Ninetales and Tapu Lele. However, Iron Head provides more consistent damage against slower foes like Hatterene and is less susceptible to PP stalling, which is particularly useful against Kyurem if Ferrothorn isn't running Body Press. Depending on its teammates, Ferrothorn can opt for Stealth Rock or Spikes, as Cradily can also set up Stealth Rock, while Meowscarada has access to Spikes and Toxic Spikes. With the combination of Leech Seed and Leftovers, Ferrothorn gains substantial recovery each turn, enabling it to wear down and punish switch-ins such as Heatran, Aegislash, and Nidoking. Protect serves as a scouting tool and extends the benefits of Leech Seed and Leftovers, while Body Press allows Ferrothorn to utilize its high Defense and deal significant damage to Steel- and Dark-types, like Melmetal and Weavile. When in conjunction with Gyro Ball, Body Press ensures that Substitute Kyurem won't be able to PP stall Ferrothorn, and when used with Iron Head, it guarantees an OHKO against Weavile. The featured EV spread both prevents a 2HKO from Choice Band Weavile's Icicle Crash and lets Ferrothorn almost always beat SubRoost Kyurem.

Ferrothorn forms a formidable defensive core with Mega Venusaur, as the latter's typing and ability enable it to come in on Fighting- and Ice-types such as Iron Valiant, Iron Moth, and Galarian Darmanitan. Additionally, Mega Venusaur's Sludge Bomb can poison foes, allowing Ferrothorn's combination of Leech Seed and Protect to wear them down more quickly. Cradily is another valuable partner, providing natural special bulk and a favorable matchup against Blacephalon and Nidoking. Offensive partners such as Rillaboom, Meowscarada, Iron Leaves, and Zarude greatly appreciate Ferrothorn weakening the opposing team with entry hazards and Leech Seed. In return, Rillaboom sets up Grassy Terrain for additional recovery and provides strong priority damage, while Choice Scarf Meowscarada can revenge kill threats such as boosted Kommo-o. Whimsicott and Celebi handle Fighting-types such as Iron Valiant and Kommo-o, which would otherwise pose a threat to Ferrothorn. Whimsicott also punishes setup sweepers like Volcarona or Mega Scizor, which could otherwise use Ferrothorn as setup fodder, while Celebi helps ease the Poison matchup, as well as the Steel matchup in a pinch.

Hazard Setter (Steel).description: As a check to Water- and Ground-types that can support its team with a wide variety of utility options, Ferrothorn is a notable defensive asset for Steel teams. Protect allows Ferrothorn to maximize the HP it gains per turn between Leftovers and Leech Seed, as well as easing prediction against Choice-locked foes such as Enamorus, Galarian Darmanitan, and Hisuian Arcanine. Power Whip minimizes passivity against the foes it's meant to check, notably OHKOing Mega Swampert and Gastrodon. Knock Off provides utility by removing Heavy-Duty Boots from foes such as Volcarona, Mantine, and Victini, leaving them vulnerable to the entry hazard stacking that is characteristic of Steel teams. The given EV spread with a Careful nature avoids a 2HKO from Landorus's Earth Power, with the rest invested in Defense to ease checking foes such as Mega Swampert, Ogerpon-W, and Mega Aerodactyl. The alternate EV spread with an Impish nature instead maximizes physical bulk, notably avoiding a 2HKO from Ogerpon-C's Low Kick. As Ferrothorn is easy to force out by Fire-type moves, Heatran is a solid partner to make a defensive core with it, especially because it can also set Stealth Rock, allowing Ferrothorn to run Spikes to hazard stack further; this can be further complemented with a check to Fighting-types in Gholdengo, which keeps entry hazards set by Ferrothorn on the other side of the field by blocking hazard removal. Offensive Pokemon such as Mega Scizor and Excadrill benefit from Ferrothorn wearing down and hindering the opposing team for a late-game sweep, mitigating Ferrothorn's passivity issues. Chople Berry is a niche alternative over Leftovers, as it enables Ferrothorn to withstand an attack from Fighting-types such as Keldeo and Urshifu-R, then KO back with Power Whip.

Physically Defensive (Dark).description: As a check to physical attackers with multiple utility options, Mandibuzz is a characteristic component for defensive backbones in Dark teams. Foul Play minimizes passivity, notably 2HKOing all Ogerpon formes, offensive Mega Scizor, Excadrill, and +6 Azumarill. U-turn lets Mandibuzz gain momentum by safely leaving potentially unfavorable matchups, bringing in checks that could struggle to switch in otherwise. Toxic lets Mandibuzz hinder entry hazard setters such as Ting-Lu, Araquanid, and Great Tusk, easing the use of Defog. Brave Bird hits some foes its team can otherwise struggle with, for example, OHKOing Hisuian Lilligant and 2HKOing Tapu Bulu and Buzzwole. The given EV spread allows Mandibuzz to outspeed Adamant Azumarill, with the rest invested in physical bulk to better handle foes such as Dragonite, Mega Lopunny, and Mega Scizor. Ting-Lu can switch into Electric- and Rock-types that can easily force out Mandibuzz like Tapu Koko, Zapdos, and Hisuian Arcanine. Alolan Muk can also further complement a defensive core, as it mitigates a weakness to Fairy-types such as Iron Valiant, Mega Diancie, and Mega Altaria. Offensive Pokemon such as Weavile, Meowscarada, and Hydreigon benefit from Mandibuzz's utility, mitigating its passivity issues.

Nasty Plot (Dark).description: Hydreigon is a threatening wallbreaker for Dark teams due to its high Special Attack stat, colorful coverage options, and a great ability in Levitate, which allows it to dominate Steel, Poison, Ground, and rainless Water matchups. Draco Meteor in tandem with Dragonium Z allows Hydreigon to OHKO Archaludon without a boost, outright OHKO physically defensive Ting-Lu and Alolan Muk at +2, and OHKO Hisuian Goodra at +2 after a layer of Spikes. Flamethrower threatens Steel-types like Ferrothorn, Mega Scizor, and Celesteela. Substitute provides safety against status moves from defensive Pokemon like Toxapex, Gliscor, and Ferrothorn, allowing Hydreigon to set up freely. Earth Power targets foes like Toxapex, Archaludon, Alolan Muk, and non-Air Balloon Heatran. Ting-Lu is a great partner, providing entry hazard support that makes it easier for Hydreigon to break through bulky foes, most notably allowing it to OHKO Assault Vest Iron Hands with a +2 Devastating Drake. It can also handle Volcarona with Rock Slide. Alolan Muk can handle Fairy-types like Tapu Koko, Tapu Lele, and Clefable, and, in return, Hydreigon provides a Ground immunity and threatens foes like Hippowdon. Mega Sableye provides a Fighting immunity and can cripple foes like Mega Gallade, Great Tusk, and Iron Hands with Will-O-Wisp. Additionally, Mega Sableye can use Metal Burst to get a surprise OHKO on Mega Diancie. Weavile is able to break through special walls like Blissey, Clodsire, and Alolan Muk. Choice Scarf Meowscarada revenge kills faster threats like Iron Valiant, Greninja, and Roaring Moon. In return, Hydreigon deals with physical walls like Ferrothorn, Archaludon, Skarmory, and Toxapex for them.

Offensive Quiver Dance (Bug).description: Volcarona is one of Bug's strongest setup sweepers, with a respectable Speed stat, high Special Attack, and great coverage. In addition to being one of very few special attacking options on Bug, Volcarona helps apply pressure in a variety of matchups thanks to its strong STAB moves and coverage. Fire Blast can be used over Fiery Dance for more immediate damage output. Giga Drain deals with Water- and Ground-types, most notably Swampert, Gastrodon, and Rotom-Wash. Bug Buzz can be used instead for Volcarona to overwhelm types like Dragon, Dark, and Psychic with Quiver Dance-boosted STAB attacks. Hidden Power Ground hits Heatran, allowing Volcarona to break Steel's immunity-based defensive core that can otherwise give Bug teams problems. Alternatively, Psychic can be used to damage bulky Poison-types, like Toxapex and Mega Venusaur, that can wall physical attackers like Heracross and Buzzwole. These physical attackers, in addition to Lokix and Scizor, are able to break through specially defensive walls, like Chansey and Mantine, that Volcarona struggles against. Araquanid and Armaldo provide helpful entry hazards in Sticky Web and Stealth Rock, respectively, to make sweeping mid- or late-game much easier.

Offensive Quiver Dance (Fire).description: Volcarona is one of the top setup sweepers that Fire has access to, with Quiver Dance allowing it to become a dangerous threat to teams unequipped to deal with it defensively. Psychic allows Volcarona to pressure Fighting and Poison teams, especially after one Quiver Dance, which lets Volcarona outspeed and beat Keldeo, Glimmora, and Crobat. Similarly, Giga Drain does the same to Water and Ground teams after one Quiver Dance, threatening Tapu Fini, Gastrodon, and Hippowdon. Bug Buzz covers the Psychic and Dark matchups very well and allows it to hit Roaring Moon, Ting-Lu, and Latias, which would otherwise be a challenge to deal with. Heavy-Duty Boots prevents Volcarona from being worn down by entry hazards, most notably Stealth Rock, which would otherwise stop Volcarona from being able to set up safely. Psychium Z lets Volcarona OHKO Toxapex with a +1 Shattered Psyche and beat otherwise troublesome threats like +1 Kommo-o, Iron Hands, and Clodsire. Cinderace and Mega Charizard X are especially good partners due to their ability to break through special walls such as Blissey, Clodsire, and Galarian Slowking with relative ease. Entry hazard removers such as Torkoal, Rotom-H, and Court Change Cinderace are near necessities if Volcarona is running Psychium Z. Torkoal and Rotom-H can also provide excellent utility in the form of Stealth Rock and dual screens, respectively, to help Volcarona sweep more easily. Volcanion is also an excellent partner for Volcarona that, thanks to its Water immunity, can act as a strong pivot into Pokemon like Azumarill and Mantine, which could revenge kill it or clear Quiver Dance boosts with Haze.

Utility (Fighting).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Scarf (Rock).description: Terrakion is the ideal Choice Scarf user for Rock teams due to its high Speed stat and access to powerful coverage moves in Earthquake and Close Combat. Close Combat provides coverage against Steel-, Normal-, and Dark-types such as Heatran, Mega Lopunny, and Greninja. Earthquake does heavy damage against Electric-types such as Zeraora and Tapu Koko as well as against Poison-types like Toxapex and Clodsire. Poison Jab is able to pressure Grass- and Fairy-types that Rock teams struggle to deal with, being able to OHKO Tapu Bulu and Whimsicott as well as deal high amounts of damage to Azumarill and Tapu Lele. Choice Scarf allows Terrakion to be an amazing revenge killer, outspeeding threats like Mega Lopunny and Zeraora. Terrakion pairs well with Shuckle, as its Stealth Rock and Sticky Web support allows Terrakion to net more KOs and outspeed faster Pokemon like Regieleki, Choice Scarf Meowscarada, and Adamant Barraskewda under rain. Terrakion also pairs well with Mega Diancie, which softens the likes of Great Tusk, Corviknight, and Toxapex for Terrakion thanks to its coverage. Alolan Golem helps Terrakion with the Steel matchup by trapping Pokemon such as Mega Scizor, Corviknight, and Celesteela with its ability Magnet Pull. Nihilego is able to help with the Fairy matchup with Sludge Wave dealing big damage to Pokemon such as Tapu Fini and Clefable. Tyranitar helps Terrakion by setting up sand, which boosts Terrakion's Special Defense stat, allowing it to survive Surf from Choice Scarf Greninja and Dazzling Gleam from Tapu Koko. Tyranitar also provides Pursuit support against faster Choice Scarf users such as Latias while also being able to break walls for Terrakion, allowing it to clean teams more easily.

Nasty Plot Wallbreaker.description: A colorful movepool, a great Speed tier, and Regenerator make Tornadus-T one of Flying's best wallbreakers. Bleakwind Storm can be used if Tornadus-T is paired with Mega Charizard Y, as its accuracy is not affected by sun. Focus Blast grants Tornadus-T excellent neutral coverage and is able to hit most Steel- and Rock-types, like Heatran and Tyranitar, hard. Heat Wave, however, has the benefit of nailing Jirachi, Gholdengo, and Corviknight, which makes it a better option against Psychic, Ghost, and, if using Knock Off, Steel teams. In the last slot, Taunt is preferred, so Tornadus-T can safely set up on walls like Toxapex and Ting-Lu, but Knock Off's ability to cripple the likes of defensive Heatran and Galarian Slowking is worth considering. Tornadus-T has a very poor matchup against Electric-types, so Pokemon that can deal with them, such as Landorus-T and Gliscor, are must-haves. They're also able to lay down Stealth Rock and have access to Defog, making them incredible teammates. Similarly, Corviknight and Celesteela stomach most Ice-type attacks aimed at Tornadus-T, thanks to their bulk and Steel typing. Mega Charizard Y forms a terrifying wallbreaking duo alongside Tornadus-T that breaks down shared checks such as Heatran and Blissey. Setup sweepers like Dragon Dance Dragonite and Agility Thundurus-T greatly appreciate Tornadus-T weakening or removing walls for them. 88 HP and 8 Special Defense EVs can be used over Special Attack to ensure Tornadus-T lives an Ice Beam from Choice Scarf Greninja from full health.

Electrium Z (Flying).description: Thundurus-T makes for a great setup sweeper on Flying teams thanks to its access to Agility, high Special Attack, and great coverage. Hidden Power Ice forms a great BoltBeam combination with Thunderbolt, threatening Ground-types such as the Landorus formes, Gliscor, and Garchomp, with the removal of the former two allowing it to sweep Flying teams late-game. Grass Knot handles certain Ground-types better than Hidden Power Ice such as Great Tusk, Gastrodon, and physically defensive Ting-Lu. Agility allows Thundurus-T to outspeed and threaten normally faster foes such as Iron Valiant, Enamorus, and rain-boosted Mega Swampert. Gigavolt Havoc allows Thundurus-T to immediately remove bulky threats such as Rotom-W, Hatterene, and Mega Gallade as well as hindrances to its sweep like specially defensive Celesteela, Toxapex, and Ogerpon-W. Gliscor and Landorus make for great partners, as they alleviate pressure from Thundurus-T, cover the Electric matchup, and set up entry hazards. Additionally, Gliscor provides pivoting via U-turn and removes items such as Heavy-Duty Boots from Dragonite and Zapdos, while Landorus's coverage allows it to cover threats such as Mega Charizard X, Tyranitar, and Tapu Bulu. Entry hazard removal from Corviknight and Mantine is appreciated by Thundurus-T due to its vulnerability to Stealth Rock. Additionally, Corviknight and Celesteela handle Fairy- and Rock-types like Tapu Bulu, Mega Diancie, and Iron Boulder. Early-game wallbreakers such as Tornadus-T and Mega Charizard Y remove walls that Thundurus-T struggles with such as Mega Venusaur and Ferrothorn. In return, they appreciate Thundurus-T's Electric immunity. Choice Scarf Enamorus provides great speed control, with it potentially being able to sweep through Dragon and Dark teams that lack a proper answer; it also provides Healing Wish support to potentially re-enable a sweep from Thundurus-T. In return, it handles Steel-types for Thundurus-T like Corviknight and Mega Scizor. Thundurus-T's ability to threaten walls such as Toxapex, Great Tusk, and Ting-Lu can also enable other sweepers like Dragonite, Mega Aerodactyl, and Galarian Moltres to start a sweep of their own.

Gravity (Ground).description: Due to its potent ability, admirable offensive stats, and great coverage, Landorus cements itself as a staple wallbreaker on Ground teams. Sludge Wave hits Grass-types like Tapu Bulu and Celebi as well as other Fairy-types such as Tapu Lele and Clefable, easing the Fairy and Grass matchups due to unresisted coverage. Focus Blast breaks through Kyurem, Ting-Lu, and Ferrothorn. Rock Polish enables Landorus as a late-game cleaner, shutting down revenge killing abilities from faster foes like Tapu Koko, Choice Scarf Galarian Darmanitan, and Greninja, while Nasty Plot allows Landorus to easily break past the likes of Blissey and Mega Sableye and become terrifying with Gravity-aided Earth Power spam. Rock Slide is another option to hit Volcarona, as it is dangerous once set up, as well as Mantine, Zapdos, and Araquanid; however, using it is very situational and forces Landorus to use an unpreferred nature. Gravity allows Landorus to ease the Flying and Steel matchups and easily spam Earth Power, increasing its potential to new heights and also supporting its teammates like Choice Band Sand Rush Excadrill. Gastrodon is a great teammate due to its ability to soak up Water-type moves from foes like Barraskewda and Mega Swampert, while Gastrodon appreciates Landorus's ability to threaten Grass-types with Sludge Wave. Mamoswine is heavily valued as a sponge for Ice-type moves due to its ability Thick Fat, taking on SubRoost Kyurem and Alolan Ninetales. In return, Mamoswine cleans up Flying teams once Landorus deals with Celesteela, Corviknight, or Skarmory. Choice Scarf or Bulk Up Great Tusk forms a great wallbreaking core, taking out threats like Triple Axel Mega Lopunny and Dragonite, while also appreciating Gravity support. Clodsire provides entry hazards to chip down walls for Landorus, switches into revenge killers like Meowscarada and Tapu Koko, and counters Volcarona with Unaware so Landorus doesn't need to use Rock Slide. Mega Steelix is valued in the Ice and Fairy matchups, taking on Alolan Ninetales, Tapu Koko, Azumarill, and Weavile. Mega Garchomp and Garchomp threaten specially defensive walls like Slowking, Blissey, and Mantine while also providing a Water neutrality with decent defensive stats.

Wallbreaker (Flying).description: By virtue of its STAB moves, coverage options, and helpful ability in Sheer Force, Landorus makes for a great wallbreaker, matching up well against Dragon, Electric, and Psychic teams and handling the likes of Raging Bolt and Kyurem. Focus Blast targets Dark- and Ice-types like Hydreigon, Piloswine, and Kyurem and can 2HKO switch-ins like Rotom-W, Skarmory, and Ferrothorn. Alternatively, Rock Slide in tandem with a neutral nature and 4 Attack EVs can be used to target Flying- and Bug-types such as Mega Charizard Y, Zapdos, and Volcarona; it also breaks Gholdengo's Air Balloon and hits Ice-types more accurately than Focus Blast. Sludge Wave takes on Grass- and Fairy-types such as Tapu Bulu and Celebi. Stealth Rock wears down incoming foes so that Landorus and its teammates can wallbreak and sweep more efficiently, and it breaks Sturdy from Ogerpon-C. Alternatively, Rock Polish allows Landorus to serve as a cleaner as well by outspeeding and threatening Choice Scarf Weavile, Greninja, and Meowscarada. Tornadus-T makes for a great teammate, taking on problematic Grass- and Fighting-types such as Ogerpon-C, Hisuian Lilligant, and Mega Gallade. Corviknight and Mantine both remove Stealth Rock with Defog so Landorus has an easier time switching in. Corviknight also threatens Ice-types such as Weavile and Alolan Ninetales and provides slow pivoting with U-turn, while Mantine fares well against Water-types like Barraskewda and Mega Swampert. Mega Aerodactyl not only threatens Ice-types, but its coverage also allows it to threaten opposing Landorus, Garchomp, and Tornadus-T; it can also run Stealth Rock so Landorus can run Rock Polish instead. Landorus's wallbreaking opens up sweeping opportunities for Galarian Moltres and Dragonite, which appreciate the removal of their checks such as Alolan Muk and Iron Hands.

Choice Scarf (Flying).description: Choice Scarf Landorus-T is one of the best revenge killers Flying teams have access to, outrunning threats like Tapu Koko, Mega Diancie, and Terrakion while boasting great firepower. It's also very desirable thanks to its defensive traits, which include an immunity to Electric-type attacks and Intimidate. U-turn takes advantage of the switches Landorus-T forces, allowing it to pivot out of walls that come in on it such as Corviknight and Mega Venusaur. Similarly, Knock Off cripples some of the bulky Pokemon it invites in, like Porygon2 and Ferrothorn, by removing their items. Stone Edge notably hits Kyurem the hardest and is Landorus-T's best move versus Flying-types like Zapdos and Pelipper. Alternatively, Explosion lets Landorus-T score a surprise KO against an offensive threat it normally cannot OHKO, such as Keldeo or Mega Lopunny. Special wallbreakers like Galarian Moltres, Tornadus-T, and Mega Charizard Y are great partners to deal with the aforementioned physical walls Landorus-T draws in. Thundurus-T relieves pressure from Landorus-T by acting as a secondary Electric immunity and is a great asset against the Water and Flying teams Landorus-T can't do much to. Mega Aerodactyl is able to form a powerful revenge killing core alongside Landorus-T while providing Stealth Rock support for it to clean teams more easily. Corviknight switches into most Ice-type attacks aimed at Landorus-T, removes Stealth Rock with Defog, and is able to bring Landorus-T safely onto the field via its slow U-turn.

Bulk Up (Ground).description:
Ferrothorn's Power Whip does not break Substitute at +1 Def or -1 Atk from Intimidate.

Choice Specs (Dragon).description: Choice Specs Kyurem is a terrifying wallbreaker with an impeccable STAB combination and coverage movepool, beating threats to Dragon teams like Toxapex, Dragonite, and Mamoswine. Draco Meteor is Kyurem's most powerful move, notably wearing down typical switch-ins like Mega Sableye and Volcarona. Freeze-Dry is highly effective in the Water matchup by answering would-be checks like Swampert, Gastrodon, and Slowking. Focus Blast catches Ferrothorn and Tyranitar off guard should they expect a STAB move, while Earth Power hits Alolan Muk, Galarian Slowking, and Heatran for more damage. Mega Altaria is heavily appreciated as an answer to Dragon-types like Kommo-o, Roaring Moon, and Walking Wake. Garchomp provides entry hazards like Stealth Rock and Spikes to ease Kyurem's wallbreaking. Latias checks Fighting-types such as Iron Hands, Galarian Zapdos, and Terrakion, is able to replenish Kyurem's health with Healing Wish, and removes troublesome entry hazards—especially Stealth Rock, given Kyurem's Rock weakness—with Defog. Dragalge sets up Toxic Spikes and checks Fairy-types like Tapu Koko and Clefable. Kommo-o checks Steel-types like Heatran and defensive Celesteela and blocks attempts to set hazards with Taunt.

Substitute + Roost (Ice).description: Kyurem is a stellar stallbreaker for Ice teams by utilizing Pressure, Substitute, and Roost to beat or force out walls such as Toxapex, Ferrothorn, and Mega Sableye. Kyurem's good bulk and typing also allow it to function as a defensive pivot, consistently checking threats like Heatran, Rotom-W, and Rillaboom. Moreover, it shrugs a hit from and beats the likes of Galarian Zapdos and Urshifu-R one-on-one if using a Chople Berry. Freeze-Dry lands a strong hit on Water-types like Toxapex and Gastrodon, turning Kyurem into a valuable asset in that matchup. Alongside it, Earth Power grants Kyurem near-perfect neutral coverage by nailing Steel- and Fire-types such as Magnezone and Skeledirge. The given EV spread allows Kyurem's Substitute to live one Seismic Toss from Blissey. Alolan Ninetales provides Snow and Aurora Veil support, bolstering Kyurem's defensive utility while preventing Celesteela and Heatran from breaking its Substitute. Defensive Cloyster is able to remove entry hazards with Rapid Spin, set up Spikes to help Kyurem stallbreak more easily, and switch into physical Steel-type attacks from Mega Scizor and Melmetal. Similarly, Piloswine lays down Stealth Rock and deals with Fire- and Rock-types that Kyurem loses to, such as Volcarona and Mega Diancie. Setup sweepers like Swords Dance Weavile and Shell Smash Cloyster greatly appreciate Kyurem wearing down walls so they can clean up late-game.

Choice Specs (Dark).description: Choice Specs Greninja is one of Dark's best wallbreakers thanks to its amazing Speed and coverage, which is further boosted by Protean. Hydro Pump targets Fire-, Rock-, and Ground-types like Torkoal, Heatran, Mega Diancie, and Hippowdon. Sludge Wave threatens Grass- and Fairy-types such as Tapu Bulu, Mega Altaria, and non-Choice Scarf Iron Valiant. Alternatively, Dark Pulse nails Ghost- and Psychic-types such as Gholdengo, Hisuian Zoroark, and Slowbro, while Trick lets Greninja weaken special walls that it cannot threaten otherwise like Alolan Muk, Hisuian Goodra, and Blissey. Sludge Wave is the preferred option out of the three, however, due to nailing threats that many of Greninja's teammates struggle with like Ogerpon-W and non-Choice Scarf Tapu Lele. Ice Beam allows Greninja to handle Dragon- and Flying-types like Garchomp, Mega Latias, and the Landorus formes. Extrasensory targets Poison- and Fighting-types like Toxapex, Mega Venusaur, Okidogi, and Keldeo. Choice Scarf Meowscarada provides speed control and forms a Protean core with Greninja, with it outspeeding and taking on Swampert, Choice Scarf Roaring Moon, and Choice Scarf Iron Valiant. Ting-Lu sets up entry hazards to aid Greninja's wallbreaking, giving Greninja a good chance to OHKO Latias after Stealth Rock damage, and it also handles Steel-types such as Excadrill, Gholdengo, and Iron Crown. Furthermore, it provides an Electric immunity, which allows it to take on Electric-types like Tapu Koko, terrain-boosted Alolan Raichu, and Zeraora. Choice Scarf Hydreigon, Mandibuzz, and Galarian Moltres aid Greninja in the Ground matchup due to their immunities. Hydreigon also deals with Choice Scarf Gholdengo and Choice Scarf Kleavor with its STAB moves; Mandibuzz removes entry hazards with Defog and pivots Greninja in with U-turn; and Galarian Moltres can sweep late-game with Agility and Nasty Plot after Greninja wallbreaks. Alolan Muk's great special bulk helps Greninja deal with Fairy-types like Tapu Koko, Tapu Lele, and Enamorus. In return, Alolan Muk appreciates Greninja taking on Ground-types like Great Tusk and Garchomp. Greninja's wallbreaking opens the door for sweeping and cleaning opportunities from the likes of Galarian Moltres and Weavile.
